channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei is killed in Israeli strike, ending 36-year iron rule
item.description: Khamenei, the Islamic Republic's second supreme leader, has been killed. He had held power since 1989, guiding Iran through difficult times — and overseeing the violent suppression of dissent.
item.content:encoded:
Khamenei, the Islamic Republic's second supreme leader, has been killed. He had held power since 1989, guiding Iran through difficult times — and overseeing the violent suppression of dissent.

(Image credit: Atta Kenare)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Here's how world leaders are reacting to the US-Israel strikes on Iran
item.description: Several leaders voiced support for the operation – but most, including those who stopped short of condemning it, called for restraint moving forward.
item.content:encoded:
Several leaders voiced support for the operation – but most, including those who stopped short of condemning it, called for restraint moving forward.

(Image credit: Alastair Grant)
item.dc:creator: NPR's International Desk

item.title: What to know about the U.S. and Israeli attacks on Iran
item.description: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in Israeli airstrikes with U.S. support on Saturday. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said.
item.content:encoded:
Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in Israeli airstrikes with U.S. support on Saturday. "Operation Epic Fury" will be "massive and ongoing," President Trump said.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Panic, fury, and some hope, in Iran as U.S. launches strikes
item.description: In Tehran, panicked residents rushed home to shelter and terrified children poured out of classrooms as U.S. air strikes hit the capitol.
item.content:encoded: In Tehran, panicked residents rushed home to shelter and terrified children poured out of classrooms as U.S. air strikes hit the capitol.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Kyiv's elderly endure blackouts and bombardment, clinging to warmth and hope
item.description: In Kyiv's darkened high-rises, as Russian strikes batter the Ukrainian capital, older residents endure freezing nights and power cuts, relying on volunteers, pets and faith to survive another winter.
item.content:encoded:
In Kyiv's darkened high-rises, as Russian strikes batter the Ukrainian capital, older residents endure freezing nights and power cuts, relying on volunteers, pets and faith to survive another winter.

(Image credit: Eleanor Beardsley)
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has been killed
item.description: The Iranian government has declared 40 days of national mourning after Khamenei was killed in a U.S.–Israeli attack on Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
The Iranian government has declared 40 days of national mourning after Khamenei was killed in a U.S.–Israeli attack on Saturday.

(Image credit: AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Trump says he is 'not happy' with the Iran nuclear talks but indicates he'll give them more time
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Friday he's "not happy" with the latest talks over Iran's nuclear program but indicated he would give negotiators more time to reach a deal to avert another war in the Middle East.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. President Donald Trump said Friday he's "not happy" with the latest talks over Iran's nuclear program but indicated he would give negotiators more time to reach a deal to avert another war in the Middle East.

(Image credit: Luis M. Alvarez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Australia says no to returning citizens with alleged ISIS ties from Syria
item.description: In Australia, the attempted return of people with alleged links to the Islamic State has raised questions about who bears responsibility for nationals who traveled overseas to join the Islamic State.
item.content:encoded: In Australia, the attempted return of people with alleged links to the Islamic State has raised questions about who bears responsibility for nationals who traveled overseas to join the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Kukolja

item.title: As U.S. and Iran wrap latest round of nuclear talks, Trump weighs his options
item.description: President Trump weighs his military options in Iran as his administration continues negotiating over Tehran's nuclear program.
item.content:encoded: President Trump weighs his military options in Iran as his administration continues negotiating over Tehran's nuclear program.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: A team of midlife cheerleaders in Ukraine refuses to let war defeat them
item.description: Ukrainian women in their 50s and 60s say they've embraced cheerleading as a way to cope with the extreme stress and anxiety of four years of Russia's full-scale invasion.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian women in their 50s and 60s say they've embraced cheerleading as a way to cope with the extreme stress and anxiety of four years of Russia's full-scale invasion.

(Image credit: Anton Shtuka for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis
